posts.post_content:
This is a very effective spell, particularly in multiplayer magic. On its own, not too shabby, a few points of life can make the game.
  
   
3/5

posts.post_content: No one is going to bother to destroy this. The life it gives usually adds up to a respectable amount in a white deck. Cheap and/or repeatable white spells make it go faster. Most of the time white has better choices for deck slots, but this is by no means a bad card. It works well in my deck that has Painter's Servant and bouncable white cards.

posts.post_content:
It's not even good in casual. It might buy you half a turn at most.  
One life per spell isn't enough to offset any player who has played more than two games.  
  
Also, to Wizards:  
These cards along with Rod of Ruin are taking up six artifact slots in the core set that could be occupied instead by cards that are actually useful. Please don't print them in M11.  
  
... not that they'll read/take notice of that, but it's worth a try.
